title: 114_hr3164
content: The Act may be cited as the "Pay Workers a Living Wage Act" and includes provisions for minimum wage increases. The "Pay Workers a Living Wage Act" amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage gradually over the next four years, starting at $9.00 an hour in 2016 and reaching $15.00 an hour by the fourth year. The "Pay Workers a Living Wage Act" gradually increases the minimum wage over four years, starting at $9.00 an hour in 2016 and reaching $15.00 an hour by the fourth year. The Secretary will determine the minimum wage annually thereafter based on the increase in the median hourly wage of all employees. The "Pay Workers a Living Wage Act" sets out the process for increasing the minimum wage annually based on the median hourly wage of all employees, rounded to the nearest multiple of $0.05. The Secretary will compile data on hourly wages to determine the median wage and compare it to the previous year. Tipped employees' base minimum wage is also addressed in the Act. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to increase the minimum wage annually based on the median hourly wage, starting at $3.15 an hour in 2016 and increasing by $1.50 or the necessary amount until it equals the wage in effect under section 6(a)(1). The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to increase the minimum wage annually based on the median hourly wage, starting at $3.15 an hour in 2016 and increasing by $1.50 or the necessary amount until it equals the wage in effect under section 6(a)(1). Section 3(m) is also amended regarding tips retained by employees. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to increase the minimum wage annually based on the median hourly wage. Section 3(m) is also amended to allow employees to retain tips received. An employer must inform each employee of this right. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to set the wage for tipped employees and remove certain provisions related to tipped employees. The amendments will take effect one day after the hourly wage under section 3(m)(1)(C) takes effect. Additionally, a youth minimum wage provision is included in the Act. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to set the wage for tipped employees and remove certain provisions related to tipped employees. A youth minimum wage provision is included in the Act, with adjustments to the minimum wage rates and publication requirements. The minimum wage increase is determined under specific conditions for tipped employees and those under 20 years old, with effective date set for January 1, 2016 or the first day of the third month after enactment of the Act.
